label: def-cloning-probability-function
name: Conditional Cloning Probability Function
statement: The **Conditional Cloning Probability Function**, denoted $\pi: \mathbb{R}_{\ge 0} \times \mathbb{R}_{\ge 0} \to [0, 1]$, maps the fitness potential of a companion ($v_c$) and a primary walker ($v_i$) to the probability that the "Clone" action is selected.
description: This function defines the probability of a 'Clone' action occurring based on the fitness potentials of two walkers (a companion and a primary walker). It is calculated by comparing the cloning score to a randomly drawn threshold, effectively clipping the normalized score to the valid probability range of [0, 1].

relations.description: The cloning probability is the probability that the score S(v_c, v_i) exceeds a uniform random threshold T_clone. This is equivalent to clipping the normalized score S(v_c, v_i) / p_max to the interval [0, 1].
